author: rocketRobin
body:

You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases

- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.

Just like the title, my question is. and what command instead that?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Don't understand your question.  The `variable:` drive still exists in PSCore6.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: `ls` is an alias that is no longer defined on Linux or macOS.  If you are on one of those platforms, try `gci variable:`.

title: dose "ls variable: " abandoned in ps6.x?
